unnormalised: Hey Everyone! Let’s talk about something super cool in the world of social media: Brand Collaborations!
normalised: Hey Everyone! Let’s talk about something super cool in the world of social media: Brand Collaborations!

unnormalised: Basically, it’s when two or more brands team up to create something awesome together. Think Parle-G and chai – a classic pairing! It’s a win-win. Brands get access to new audiences, boost their credibility, and come up with fresh, exciting content. And for us, the consumers? We get to see innovative products, fun campaigns, and maybe even some sweet deals!
normalised: Basically, it’s when two or more brands team up to create something awesome together. Think Parle-G and chai – a classic pairing! It’s a win-win. Brands get access to new audiences, boost their credibility, and come up with fresh, exciting content. And for us, the consumers? We get to see innovative products, fun campaigns, and maybe even some sweet deals!

unnormalised: In the influencer marketing space, brand collaborations are huge. Imagine a popular fashion influencer from Delhi collaborating with a textile brand from Jaipur to showcase traditional block printing techniques. Boom! Content gold. Or a fitness guru working with a healthy snack brand – perfect synergy.
normalised: In the influencer marketing space, brand collaborations are huge. Imagine a popular fashion influencer from Delhi collaborating with a textile brand from Jaipur to showcase traditional block printing techniques. Boom! Content gold. Or a fitness guru working with a healthy snack brand – perfect synergy.

unnormalised: Why are they so important? Well, think about it. Standing out in the crowded digital space is tough. A well-executed collaboration cuts through the noise. Plus, leveraging the existing audience trust of your partner can give your brand a major boost. Remember when Myntra collaborated with HRX back in 2013? Epic!
normalised: Why are they so important? Well, think about it. Standing out in the crowded digital space is tough. A well-executed collaboration cuts through the noise. Plus, leveraging the existing audience trust of your partner can give your brand a major boost. Remember when Myntra collaborated with H R X back in two thousand and thirteen? Epic!

unnormalised: It’s not just about slapping logos together, though. The best brand collaborations are authentic and feel natural. For example, if a skincare brand from Bangalore collaborates with a yoga instructor, they could offer free online yoga sessions alongside samples of the brand. Makes sense, right?
normalised: It’s not just about slapping logos together, though. The best brand collaborations are authentic and feel natural. For example, if a skincare brand from Bangalore collaborates with a yoga instructor, they could offer free online yoga sessions alongside samples of the brand. Makes sense, right?

unnormalised: Some recent Indian brand collaborations that caught my eye? Well, I saw a great collaboration between a mithai brand and a dating app around Diwali, offering a special "sweet meet" experience. Then there was also an educational collaboration between IIT Delhi and NIIT on 26/01/2024 and another campaign during Independence day celebration on 15/08/2024. The former provided free online certifications for underprivileged students.
normalised: Some recent Indian brand collaborations that caught my eye? Well, I saw a great collaboration between a mithai brand and a dating app around Diwali, offering a special "sweet meet" experience. Then there was also an educational collaboration between I I T Delhi and N I I T on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four and another campaign during Independence day celebration on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four. The former provided free online certifications for underprivileged students.

unnormalised: So, if you’re a brand, start thinking about who you could team up with! Remember to look for brands with aligned values and target audiences. And if you're an influencer, at 09:00 hrs, start pitching collaboration ideas that resonate with your audience. The possibilities are endless. Let me know what your favorite brand collaborations have been in the comments below! Until next time, Jai Hind!
